Trial_Design.evidence: 2203 veterans in the ROOBY trial were randomly assigned to off-pump or on-pump CABG procedures

Participants.evidence: 2203 veterans in the ROOBY trial were randomly assigned to off-pump or on-pump CABG procedures at 18 participating VA medical centers

Intervention.evidence: Interventions: On-pump and off-pump CABG procedures.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To evaluate the 10-year outcomes and costs of off-pump vs on-pump CABG in the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Randomized On/Off Bypass (ROOBY) trial.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The 10-year coprimary end points included all-cause death and a composite end point identifying patients who had died or had undergone subsequent revascularization

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: 2203 veterans in the ROOBY trial were randomly assigned

Number_Randomised.evidence: 2203 veterans in the ROOBY trial were randomly assigned to off-pump or on-pump CABG procedures

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 1104 patients (1097 men [99.4%]; mean [SD] age, 63.0 [8.5] years) were enrolled in the off-pump group, and 1099 patients (1092 men [99.5%]; mean [SD] age, 62.5 [8.5] years) were enrolled in the on-pump group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 10-year death rates were 34.2% (n = 378) for the off-pump group and 31.1% (n = 342) for the on-pump group (relative risk, 1.05; 95% CI, 0.99-1.11; P = .12).
